title: 13.1 Properties of Red-Black Trees
content:
Section 13.1

Properties of Red-Black Trees

Summary

A self-balancing BST with color properties ensuring O(log n) height.

Key Points

  • Every node is RED or BLACK
  • Root is BLACK
  • Every leaf (NIL) is BLACK
  • Red node's children must be BLACK (no two reds in a row)
  • All paths from node to descendant leaves have same black-height
  • Height ≤ 2 log(n+1) guaranteed!

Example

A red-black tree with 15 nodes has height at most 2·log(16) = 8.

Why It Matters

Guaranteed O(log n) for all operations. Used in many standard libraries.
